meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Albania.
meanings.sent1: In Albania, you can buy many things with just one koss.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for koss at the currency exchange.
meanings.sent3: Why did the coin go to school? To get smarter and become a koss!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a shiny koss, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The koss jingled in his pocket, a sound of wealth and possibility.

meanings.definition: A type of traditional Finnish bread.
meanings.sent1: Grandma baked delicious koss for breakfast every Sunday.
meanings.sent2: The bakery down the street sells the best koss in town.
meanings.sent3: Why did the loaf of koss break up with the butter? It was tired of being spread too thin!
meanings.sent4: The aroma of freshly baked koss filled the kitchen, comforting and inviting.
meanings.sent5: Each bite of the warm koss brought back memories of childhood and family gatherings.

meanings.sent1: Mr. and Mrs. Koss invited us to their family reunion.
meanings.sent2: The Koss family has a long history in this town.
meanings.sent3: Why did the Koss family always win at board games? Because they were great at 'Koss-tactics'!
meanings.sent4: The Koss name stood out like a beacon of heritage and pride.
meanings.sent5: The Koss family crest displayed a majestic lion, symbolizing strength and courage.
